front.title: Multiple Preemption Priority Policy Element for RSVP

abstract.t: RSVP Extensions are being defined allowing an endpoint to signalalternate "bandwidths" of interest in case the preferred bandwidth isnot available and allowing the RSVP routers to collectively establishthe reservation with the highest currently achievable bandwidth amongthe signaled set. This can be used to achieve efficient dynamicendpoint codec adjustment. The present document presents acomplementary set of extensions, allowing the dynamic bandwidthselection to reflect a different reservation priority for each of themultiple "bandwidth" associated with a reservation.
